column4: Hmm, how do I make cp NOT overwrite existing files? (Without -i, because then I'll have to hit 'No' for every file.)
Weird... My firefox just started exiting with status 0 when run... It's like it doesn't even try to start up.
Are you running firefox from a terminal window?
Yup
Installed any plugins or extensions recently?
Yeah, but it ran fine for a while. Untill X crashed.
Was it a plugin or an extension?
I had to restart firefox to finish the extension install and it came up just fine afterwards.
extension.
yep..
I installed like 6 extensions...
But I think I've started firefox 8 times since then --- no problems.
Try running the profile manager.. firefox -ProfileManager
Maybe something stuffed with the default profile..
Create a new profile..
And run with that..
I'm trying, but nothing happens. :(
So you can't even create a new profile?
Yeah, I can, but I can't run ff with it.
firefox -P profile
Doesn't work?
Nope, it just hangs.
Hmm... that hurts bad..
Indeed...
I tried debugging a little with strace, but it doesn't say anything unusual.
Time to reinstall or delete your .mozilla directory..
Well, my .mozilla dir ain't going nowhere... So perhaps an FF reinstall...
Maybe only delete the /home/madsen/.mozilla/firefox directory..
Yeah, that's the one I want to keep. :) Well, perhaps copy the firefox-dir to a different location and then try replacing the pref-files one by one and see which one b0rks it.
But I doubt it's anything with my profile since I can't create a new one...
Hmm, removing the .mozilla/firefox dir didn't do anything... It still just hangs... (Instead of returning 0 as it did with the original profile.)
So I guess a reinstall is in order.. :(
Yup, and that did the job. Now it even works again with my old profile and settings. :)
Thanks for your time. :)
Strange..
So you still have the extensions etc?
yup!
But yeah, indeed odd...
I have trouble understanding how the system firefox install was corrupted...
Yeah, me too.
It might have something to do with my X crashing. (That's when it stopped working.)
I'm playing with the composite extension and stuff and it _is_ pretty unstable after all...
Doing your own extension work?
No, just messing around with drop-shadows in Xorg and stuff.
Cool.. looks good no doubt (when it is running)..
any screenshots?
It runs alright here, but it is a bit unstable.
I can make you one, just a sec.
How is your screenshot going?
http://lillesvin.net/stuff/ubuntu_shadows.png
Sorry about the delay, my X crashed again (probably because of the composite ext.)
Nice!!
Only problem is the gnome panels look so plain compared to the window toolbars..
Yeah, but the menu and the clock overlays the bg image, so it's really hard to make it look better.
So are you a tester or are you just interested in crashing every 15 minutes? :)
the latter. :)
Just had to try it out. I've spent sooo long on Debian missing such options.
Do any other window managers have that feature?
Well, the feature is implemented in Xorg and the WMs can utilize it... So basically all WMs have it...
Nice.. seems like the Xorg guys are really firing up..
Yeah. Alpha transparency is also supported now, though I don't know how to use it. Hehe.
In reasonably short time translucent menus and good drop shadows should be a reality in Linux.
What country are you from?
Denmark, why?
It's not filled out in your profile.. :)
What profile?
When I right click on your IRC username..
Oh! :)
I use irssi, so I don't "right click" anywhere. ;)
My project at the moment is getting my Sun Rays to work on Ubuntu.. pretty much everything figured out except ALSA sound..
Sub Rays?
Sun, even.
Yeah.. Sun Ray thin clients..
Oh! Sweet!
http://nz.sun.com/product-images/large/I1_hw_sunray150_lg.jpg
Picked them up for $85 (Australian Dollars)..
Nice! :)
The library in a town where I used to live had like 40 of those. They're pretty nice!
I have a few around the house.. so I have Internet/Music roaming with my smart card..
Hehe, neat!
Those wobbly windows are pretty cool!
Yeah. :)
So what do I need to have the wobbly windows on Ubuntu? :)
Hehe, I have absolutely no clue. :)
Perhaps the latest CVS version of Xorg and some patches for it and an insane gfx card. ;)
Good point!
What do you think of the Sun Looking Glass interface?
Looks pretty nice, but a bit over the top for me. :)
I loaded it up on SUSE a while ago.. it was cool.. but limited..
Didn't it require your first born and an evil gfx card?
It ran okay on my GeForce 2 GTS..
Really! I'll have to try it out some time. :)
